alert.note: Alert for Calcasieu; Cameron; Jefferson Davis (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 30 at 9:31PM CST until December 01 at 12:30AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Calcasieu Parish in southwestern Louisiana... North Central Cameron Parish in southwestern Louisiana... Southwestern Jefferson Davis Parish in southwestern Louisiana... * Until 1230 AM CST. * At 931 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lake Charles, Iowa, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Grand Lake, Hayes, Holmwood, Hacketts Corner, Heberts Marina, Carlyss, Hackberry, Bell City and Lacassine. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
